poem:
Title: Weighed By Need

A hungry sky spills parcels divine,
Scattering hope on a death-rattle line.
Battling bodies surge, frantic to claim,
Each captured morsel a pawn in the game.
But what chance that aid takes root in the fray,
When hunger turns brother against brother in this grim ballet?
All too brief, this feast from the air,
Leaves Gaza gasping, still in despair.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
